intro: Taverniera stocksii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Taverniera stocksii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
